summary: Draining wetlands can harm water quality and wildlife habitat. Millions of acres of wetlands known as "potholes" remain in the Midwest, often on farms. The U.S. Department of Agriculture can withhold benefits from farmers who violate wetlands conservation rules. We found USDA: checks about 1% of the applicable land a year identified fewer than 5 violations a year in the states with the most wetlands...
title: Farm Programs: USDA Should Take Additional Steps to Ensure Compliance with Wetland Conservation Provisions
